help.registeredObjectType:
Registered Object Type - Select the links below for definition:
  • Physical sample
  • Sample collection
  • Sampling feature
help.visibility:
The visibility of the descriptive metadata for a sample.
  • Publicly visible - The descriptive metadata is publicly visible in the ARDC IGSN portal and exposed via the OAI-PMH protocol for harvesting.
  • Private - The descriptive metadata is only visible by authorised users.
  • Under embargo - Until the embargo date elapses, the descriptive metadata is only visible by authorised users. After the embargo date has elapsed, the descriptive metadata is visible in the ARDC IGSN portal and exposed via the OAI-PMH protocol for harvesting.
help.embargoDate:
Enter an end date for the embargo in a valid W3CDTF format.

The resource will be not be publicly visible until the embargo date.
help.resourceTitle: Short title or description of the sample, e.g. Zircons from fraser range amphibolite on expoxy SHRIMP mount sample number 175423
help.logDate: Use this element to indicate an event (the status of a resource or its registration) and its timestamp

help.curationDetails: Resource archival information, mainly applicable to physical samples and sample collections. The curating institution must be specified. This can be present or future curator.
help.curatorName: The full name of the sample or data curator.
help.identifierType:
Identifier type

  • ARK - Archival Resource Key.
  • arXiv - Identifier for scholarly articles in arXiv archive
  • bibcode - Bibcode identifier.
  • DOI - Digital Object Identifier.
  • EAN13 - International Article Number (also known as European Article Number or EAN)
  • EISSN - Electronic International Standard Serial Number (e-ISSN)
  • Handle - Handle identifier.
  • IGSN - International Geo Sample Number
  • ISBN - International Standard Book Number 
  • ISNI -  International Standard Name Identifier
  • ISSN - International Standard Serial Number 
  • ISTC -  International Standard Text Code 
  • LISSN - Linking ISSN (ISSN-L)
  • Local - local identifier scheme
  • LSID - Life Science Identifier
  • ORCID - Open Researcher and Contributor ID
  • PMID - PubMed record identifier
  • PURL - Persistent Uniform Resource Locator  
  • ROR - Research Organization Registry identifier
  • UPC - Universal Product Code.
  • URL - Uniform Resource Locator. 
  • URN - Uniform Resource Name.
  • VIAF - Virtual International Authority File
help.curationDate: The date the sample or item was moved to its current location.
help.curationLocation: The location (address) where the sample or item is stored. This can be general or specific (room number, building name).
help.curatingInstitution: The institution where the sample or item is stored.
help.institutionURI: The URL of the institution where the sample or item is stored.
help.relatedResourceRelationType:
The relationship between the resource being registered and other entity (e.g., event, document, parent sample, etc.)

  • Collected as part of - indicates that the resource was collected as part of an activity or project.
  • Has association with - has an undefined relationship with the related resource.
  • Has digital representation - this relation maybe used to reference ae digitized version of a physical sample;inverse relation of 'isDigitalRepresentationOf'.
  • Has reference resource - indicates the relation between a sample and its reference sample. A physical sample is usually inspected for identity, physical purity and compared with a reference sample.
  • Has sampling feature - this relates a sampling feature (observation well) to a physical sample (water specimen); inverse relation of 'isSamplingFeatureOf'.
  • Is aggregate of - indicates that the resource is an arbitrary aggregation of the related (target) resource.
  • Is derived from - indicates that the resource is created/obtained from a parent resource.
  • Is digital representation of - this relation maybe used to indicate the digitized version of a physical sample.
  • Is documented by - indicates the documentation of the resource, including datasets, reports, images, supplementary metadata, etc.
  • Is identical to - a resource that is the same as the registered resource.
  • Is member of - indicates the registered resource is used to compile or create the target resource (related resource); inverse relation of 'isAggregateOf'.
  • Is sampling feature of - this relates a physical sample (water specimen) to its sampling feature (observation well).
  • Is source of - indicates the resource A is a source upon which the resource B is based); inverse relation of 'derivedFrom'.
  • Participates - A resoure participates in an event.

validation.url: Please enter a valid URL. E.g. https://example.com
validation.resourceTitle: Provide a title for the sample or item
validation.resourceType: Select a sample or item type
validation.curatorName: Enter the name of the resource curator
validation.curatorIdentifier: Identifier must must be provided when specifying an identifier for a curator
validation.curatorIdentifierType: Creator Identifier type must be provided when specifying an identifier for a creator.
validation.date: Enter a valid date in the YYYY-MM-DD format
validation.relatedResourceIdentifier: Related Identifier must be provided when specifying a related resource
validation.relatedResourceIdentifierType: Identifier type must be provided when specifying an identifier for a related resource
validation.relatedResourceRelationType: Relation type must be provided when specifying a related resource
